title: How money is created out of thin air

sections.text: Most people believe banks lend out money that already exists. They imagine banks as vaults taking deposits from savers and handing that same money to borrowers.
That intuition feels natural. It is also wrong.
In modern economies, most money is created when banks issue loans. When a bank approves a loan, it does not transfer existing money from someone else’s account.
Instead, it creates new money digitally by crediting the borrower’s account. Money appears not from printing presses, but from accounting entries.
Because money is created through lending, interest rates strongly influence inflation, growth, and employment even when nothing physical changes.
Most money is not printed by governments. It is quietly created when loans are issued and destroyed when they are repaid.
